alt CD can do text-only as well.  But whatever CD, you've checked for defects?

well, freezing at particular packages (especially consistantly at the same package) really leans towards bad burn.  You might try grabbing the minimal iso, and see if you can install from that (downloads packages from the interblags)
Do you have space after your 80G partition?
Go to manual partitioning, and then create the partitions after your 80G one
I tried that, it yelled at me saying that no root file system was defined
Once you create the partition, you have to give it a mount point.  That mount point will be / (root), this is for your main OS partition
How much RAM do you have? and do you plan on hibnernating?
You need at least 1G of swap then.
Doesn't matter a whole lot.  With 1G of RAM, you probably will almost never use your swap, except for hibernation
No, when you format it as "swap" it knows what its doing
It's entirely likely that you can't do the former.  Windows tends to assume its the only OS in the world
